Tax Manager

Company Name Deloitte Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 9 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Are you passionate about making an impact that matters with Private clients to help them grow their businesses in an ever-changing Tax landscape? As a member of the Deloitte Tax team, you will help our clients to navigate through their most complex tax & accounting issues, anticipating and managing tax and regulatory changes, providing complex tax advice and innovative tax compliance solutions.

About the team
 Our Deloitte Tax team has experienced significant recent growth, which has created opportunities for outstanding professionals with a hunger for success. You will be challenged to add value and partner with clients at an early stage, to generate different solutions to client situations in an entrepreneurial and flexible work environment.

About the role
 Our Deloitte Private team provides leading taxation and accounting expertise to Australia's largest and most complex private entities and the families that own them. We assist in growing, managing and protecting their businesses across a wide array of industry sectors including property, hospitality, retail, technology, agribusiness and transport.

You will be involved in the provision of Tax & Accounting services to our clients including:
* Income tax advisory, and Income tax compliance and planning
* Tax structuring
* Tax & Accounting matters associated with trust and estate planning
* Preparation of monthly and annual financial statements

Why consider a career within Deloitte Tax?
* Exposure to sophisticated and high profile privately owned businesses
* Ability to be involved with and advise on complex and challenging transactions
* Exposure to all levels of staff with close involvement with the management group
* Contribution to the business and assisting the business to achieve its strategy through key internal support

About your experience
 As a Manager within this fast paced and dynamic team, you will be involved in the provision of Tax services to our clients and will require the following skills, experience and qualifications:
* Completed your CA, Masters of Tax or similar qualification, and have strong tax technical and analytical skills
* Prior Tax advisory experience, with exposure to unlisted corporate clients and transactions advisory work
* A naturally inquisitive mindset and desire to understand your clients overall operations, allowing you to deliver the most impactful long term outcome
* Exceptional written and verbal communications skills, with an ability to consult with and influence stakeholders from all backgrounds and at all levels
* Strong mentorship and leadership skills, with a passion for coaching junior team members

About us: Deloitte Culture
We pride ourselves on our team of diverse, high performing Deloitte professionals who are talented, supportive, inclusive and social - and who are at the heart of our success. Our aim is to ensure that all our people feel comfortable to bring their whole selves to work, and as a result, create a workplace that encourages the true spirit of 'And different'.

From day one at our firm you will be considered part of the Deloitte community and our development and career progression framework will help you develop the skills and capabilities you need to succeed - in every sense of the word.

By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We've designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.

Next Steps
 If this sounds like an exciting opportunity that aligns with your experience, career goals and timeline, we want to hear from you! Click "Apply" below and submit your application.

If you have questions, regarding this role please contact Marlon Vallarta from the Talent Acquisition team via email at

The minimum salary for this role is $100,000 AUD which is inclusive of a 9.5% super contribution.

Job description

A fantastic opportunity is available for a proactive and team oriented individual to join the Finance team as a Financial Accountant. Based at our head office in Mulgrave, in this role you will prepare and maintain timely and accurate financial information to satisfy the reporting needs and decision making requirements of internal and external stakeholders.

\xa0

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Financial Accounting, your key responsibilities will include:

\xa0

  • Support with monthly profit and loss and balance sheet reports for management and controlling department
  • Involvement of monthly reporting under IFRS for submission to Headquarters
  • Controlling all uploads into the Pre-Owned Vehicle Management system and ensuring correct postings into the system
  • Data validation into Lease Management System and monthly reconciliation
  • Monthly reconciliation of Balance Sheet Accounts and preparation of month end stock reports
  • Assisting with timely execution of financial closing procedures
  • Processing fixed asset requisitions, disposals and transfers
  • Supporting with preparation of annual financial statements and statutory reports
  • Supporting with external audits
  • Monthly reconciliations of balance sheet accounts
  • Reconcile and report on assigned general ledger accounts for SAP


In order to be successful in this role, you will be degree qualified in a business, finance or accounting discipline and be either CA or CPA qualified (or working towards this qualification). You will have a strong understanding of the accounting principles and how they apply to a commercial setting. Your strong communication and interpersonal skills and ability to work closely with a variety of key stakeholders will be crucial to your success. It goes without saying that you will have meticulous attention to detail and strong analytical skills as well as the ability to manage and juggle competing priorities in a dynamic and fast paced environment. Your career in Accenture Products

Supply Chain Management Principal Director

Accenture Products Group

Our Products Group brings together people with first-class consultancy skills and specialist industry expertise. You will develop a career working across a range of industries including retail, consumer goods and services, automotive, infrastructure and travel. To join us here you’ll need the sharp thinking to solve complex business problems and provide deep industry insight and technological know-how on a global level. The scope of the role, exposure to clients and cutting-edge technologies will provide an ideal platform to develop your consulting career.

Role Requirements

Working closely with our clients, Consulting professionals design, build and implement strategies that can help enhance business performance. They develop specialized expertise—strategic, industry, functional, technical—in a diverse project environment that offers multiple opportunities for career growth.

Supply Chain Leaders formulate supply chain strategies that go beyond company boundaries and functional areas through an understanding of the effects of manipulating supply chain levers at the operating model level. They design and implement process and change interventions that integrate strategy, technology and people to enable process improvements that create value for clients.

A professional at this position level within Accenture has the following responsibilities:

Job description

Head of Melbourne Airport

  • Challenge yourself in this strategic leadership role
  • Together we will drive airport strategy and deliver on Qantas objectives.
  • Permanent Full-time
  • Based in Melbourne

Delighting people and creating lasting relationships means we do things differently. We stand out by disrupting the norm and challenging ourselves to reinvent what’s possible.

Airports are the heart of our operation. It’s here people connect with the spirit of Australia from the confidence of seeing and interacting with our people, to the sheer awe that comes from watching our aircraft take off and land. The success we’ve achieved hasn’t been a matter of luck. It’s a direct result of our strategic leadership. This means taking accountability for driving results, being competitive and influencing outcomes.

The Head of Melbourne is a pivotal role in strategically managing and ensuring the success of the Airport Operations. You are responsible for the overall strategic leadership, development, management and control of the Customer Service and Ground Operations Teams as well as management oversight for Terminal Operations and 3rd party clients for one of Qantas’ largest Airport Operations, Melbourne Domestic and International Airport.

In this highly visible and business critical role which will require you to work collaboratively with all business units across Melbourne Airport to ensure we drive airport strategy and deliver on Qantas safety, service, operational, people, compliance and financial objectives.

Your strategic approach will assist in challenging existing business practices with the aim to enhance sustainable competitive advantage, business effectiveness and achieve business and customer service goals. Pivotal to this, will be your ability to deliver value and develop exceptional relationships with key stakeholders across the Airport and supporting business units.

To succeed in this role, you will demonstrate significant prior experience in a senior leadership role with a strong operational focus, in a dynamic working environment. You will be able to demonstrate strong people leadership, innovative problem solving, strong negotiating skills, as well as, an extensive knowledge of operating under multiple award-covered workforces, and within Safety Management Systems.

  • Strong influencing skills, resilience and a proven ability to navigate complexity in an ever-changing operational environment
  • An understanding of business fundamentals, with a proven customer centric approach through anticipating evolving customer needs and acting on them at an individual level
  • Demonstrated expertise in appropriate project management tools and in exercising judgement in cause and effect / problem-solving thinking
  • Proven relationship management and stakeholder engagement skills
  • Excellent leadership skills with a track record of developing and leading high performing teams

Qantas is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at time of application.

If you’re ready for a culture that will challenge and excite you, submit an application.

Senior User Experience Designer

Company Name Aconex Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 12 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Senior User Experience Designer - CEGBU
  • Melbourne CBD


We are looking for one permanent UXer and one 12 month fixed term contractor.


Oracle's Construction and Engineering\xa0business unit is the leading global provider of on premises and cloud-based project portfolio management solutions for improving strategy execution, operational excellence, and financial performance across the enterprise. Asset owners and project leaders rely on Oracle Construction and Engineering software for the visibility and control, connected supply chain, and data security needed to drive performance and mitigate risk across their processes, projects, and organization.


As a Senior User Experience Designer in our UX team, your work will be varied. Some days you'll be rubbing elbows with our close-knit agile engineering teams, making products that users love. Others, you'll be talking with users in an office around the corner—or on the other side of the world. In a typical week you might deal with stakeholder feature requests, analyze a process, design a workflow, define and create interaction flows, wireframes, review feedback on released features, and drive new features in web or mobile apps.


We're a close-knit, collaborative group and we support each other in achieving our company's goals. Our UX designers are expected to have a seat at the table with the other product development stakeholders.

\xa0

Here’s the kind of person we’re looking for:


We are looking for experienced Senior UX Designers with a passion for creating best-in-class experiences for our various construction and engineering products. You’ll be contributing and collaborating with the larger design org, defining reusable patterns and extending the design language we use across all apps.


  • You are passionate about solving complex problems through elegant and simple interaction and design solutions.
  • You thrive on working well with others. You make the people around you better. You love to collaborate with UXers, researchers, engineers, business analysts, product managers, executives, and inspire them to do their best.
  • You are an advocate for the end user. You balance technical and delivery constraints when creating accessible and engaging user interfaces based on complex requirements and tight deadlines.
  • You are skilled in your craft and appropriately apply different methodologies to adapt to the situation at hand. \xa0
  • You have excellent communication, facilitation, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills including the ability to communicate complex, interactive design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences.
  • You love rules and you know when to break them. You think systemically because you know that creating a coherent experience requires it. But you know when the system needs to expand to accommodate the variety of user conceptual models. And you know when to do something completely unique to create an arresting and product-defining moment that makes users ooh and aah.
  • You love finding out you’re wrong. You consume large amounts of quantitative and qualitative data to constantly refine your assumptions.
  • You’re confident in planning and executing user research and usability studies. You know the importance of understanding user behaviors, needs, motivations and the impact this has on the product you design.
  • You exhibit a growth mindset and have a willingness to own problems. You embrace ambiguity and always think the glass is half full.
  • And finally, you want to be part of creating dramatic and impactful change at a company that is committed to becoming a light unto others when it comes to user experience.

\xa0

Qualifications & previous experience:


  • BA/BS degree in Design, HCI, CS or related field, or equivalent practical experience, or equivalent industry specific experience.
  • 4+ years of demonstrable industry experience in UX design or Information architecture. Experience with visual and interaction design tools (Sketch, Adobe CS, InVision etc.).

\xa0

Desirable Experience:


  • Experience with storyboarding, customer journey mapping or service design.
  • Experience with responsive or mobile design.
  • Experience with location positioning (geolocation, beacons), AR/VR or drones.
  • Knowledge of cloud computing.
  • Knowledge of the construction sector.

\xa0


Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.



Life at Oracle ANZ:


An Oracle career can span industries, roles, countries and cultures, giving you the opportunity to take on new roles and challenges, while blending work and life. Oracle has thrived through 40+ years of change by innovating and operating with integrity while delivering for the top companies in almost every industry. To cultivate the talent that makes this happen, we work hard to create a vibrant and rewarding workplace that celebrates diverse, multi-talented teams where everyone can contribute. We take care of each other, and value giving back to the community. We have flexible work arrangements and offer benefits including generous paid parental leave and comprehensive premium medical insurance... Find out more

About the role

The Accounts Specialist is responsible for the accounts payable and receivable functions of the LOC and is someone who will thrive in a high-paced and collaborative project-based environment. The role will ensure that transactions are processed accurately and paid on time and compliance with underlying internal control systems and processes.

\xa0

This is a unique opportunity to be a part of the Local Organising Committee who will be working together to deliver A Spectacular Celebration in 2020.

\xa0

About you

  • You have had senior experience working in a fast-paced and diverse accounts function, with demonstrated ability to operate in an organisation that has rapid growth
  • You have sound knowledge of accounts processing technical matters including GST and tax invoice requirements and an understanding of internal control requirements and best practice accounts processes
  • You have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and the ability to manage competing priorities
  • You have meticulous attention to detail, exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills
  • You have a customer focused, solutions-oriented approach to your work, and enjoy building relationships with key stakeholders

\xa0

To be successful in this role, you must have a high level of initiative, be adaptable in your approach and enjoy working in a high energy, innovative and fast paced setting with a proven ability to deliver on immovable deadlines under pressure ideally gained within the major events or sporting landscape.

\xa0

Keen to join our team?

To obtain a full position description, please visit www.icc-cricket.com/world-t20/jobs

\xa0

Applications must be emailed to jobs@worldt20.com.au and include a cover letter outlining your interest and expectations by midnight Wednesday 17 October 2018.

\xa0

\xa0

The WT20 offer a competitive salary package, employee benefits, flexible working conditions and a fun working environment.

We embrace differences in gender, age, ethnicity, race, cultural background, disability, religion and sexual orientation. We value diversity. We encourage all people to apply for this role.

Applicants must be able to obtain legal working rights in Australia.

School Crossing Supervisors

Company Name Manningham City Council Company Location Doncaster, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 6 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


  • Support your local community during school terms
  • Part time and casual hours available
  • 45 minute shifts in the morning and/or afternoon

At Manningham Council, we are people who invest in people. We’re a values based organisation who has a big responsibility to deliver 100 diverse services to our community.

School Crossing supervisors play a vital role in ensuring the safety of our community. During school terms Crossing Supervisors are responsible for assisting school children and other pedestrians at established children’s crossings and traffic lights.

We are seeking positive, reliable, active and engaged people who are willing to support our community to supervise school crossings on both a casual and part time basis. You need to be able to operate and handle safety equipment, have good judgement and road sense, be able to get to and from your rostered crossing and be available to work shifts, morning, afternoon or both. You will need a valid Working with Children Check and be willing to undergo a National Police Records Check.

If you have any questions about the position please contact Jane Churchley, City Compliance Support Officer on 9840 9218. For all other enquiries email

CHIEF INFORMATION OFFICER

Company Name SHK Asia Pacific Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 125 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


  • Lead and build technology teams
  • Evaluate and integrate new and disruptive technologies
  • Operational and strategic balance


This leading education institution enjoys a proud history of commercial success and is one of Victoria’s most prominent vocational training providers. It has multiple campuses across metropolitan and regional Victoria and an ambitious growth agenda in domestic and international markets. Embarking on its next five-year strategy, there is a clear vision to achieve sustainable growth, and best practice education outcomes for students and industry.

The Chief Information Officer (CIO) is responsible for modernising the technology landscape of the organisation and creating the next-gen digital campus experience that connects people, processes and services, and optimises learning pedagogy, teacher quality and learner outcomes. A new role that reports to the CEO, the CIO will identify and develop existing system improvements, manage knowledge and streamline workflows, integrate technology into key business processes, set the digital strategy for the future, implement a flexible and secure information technology infrastructure, and lift the operation to new and improved levels of service and performance.

As a senior technology executive, you pride yourself on your strategic thinking and understanding of contemporary and emerging technology solutions. Your high results-orientation, excellent communication and influencing skills, commercial acumen, and experience leading large, complex technology transformation programs will be crucial to your success. You will also have relevant tertiary qualifications, preferably at the post graduate level.

To apply for this role please email your resume to applymel@shk.com.au quoting reference number JO-1809-26599 and for more information please call Brian Barry on 03 8620 8049.

Company Name YMCA Whittlesea Company Location South Morang, Victoria, Australia

Job description

Are you looking to make a difference in your community and help to shape its future, working with a great not for profit organisation like the YMCA?

YMCA Whittlesea is now seeking expressions of interest from local community people that would like to take an active role in the future of the YMCA Whittlesea and the programs we deliver in your community.

\xa0

The YMCA provides a large range of programs and services to the community including: Leisure and Recreation, Children’s Services, Youth and Disability services, Social programs, and many other services. Our work aims to build connections between people, help people to become stronger and more empowered and to improve overall community health and wellbeing. We embrace diversity and invite people of all backgrounds, ages and abilities to consider a position on our Board.

\xa0

We are seeking new Board members that can help us achieve the great work that we do, in the areas of; business, fundraising, finance, events, community services, or leadership skills. Applicants will be passionate about the local community and have the desire to help those less fortunate, understand local community needs and represent the community through a range of interests, memberships or other involvement.


Applicants with legal or financial skills are highly desirable.

\xa0

Our voluntary Board of Directors is fundamental in increasing connections and levels of engagement within the City of Whittlesea. We would welcome you to contact us and consider a position on our Board.


For further information please email courtney.anderson@ymca.org.au
